Recently, I had to make a `ggplot2` graphic where the x-axis was representing dates.

```{r}
n <- 10

df <- tibble(
  x = seq(as.Date("2020-01-01"), as.Date("2020-10-10"), length.out = n),
  y = rnorm(n)
)

df

p <- df %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "6 weeks", date_labels = "%B-%d")

p
```

``` {.bash}
sudo nano /etc/locale.gen
```

![My locale.gen configuration file](/2020-10-11-how-to-change-the-language-of-date-in-r/index.en_files/locale_gen.png)

``` {.bash}
sudo locale-gen fr_FR.UTF-8
```

```{r}
Sys.setlocale("LC_TIME", "fr_CA.UTF-8")
p
```
